20110123034140.000|20110123034142.000|TR0|
20110123034142.000|20110123034144.000|TR0|SAVIDGE:  You know, earlier, we showed you 
20110123034144.000|20110123034147.000|TR0|how sophisticated cyber criminals are 
20110123034147.000|20110123034149.000|TR0|getting and that they're using RFID.  
20110123034149.000|20110123034151.000|TR0|That's the radio signal that you use to 
20110123034151.000|20110123034154.000|TR0|make a purchase by waving your credit card 
20110123034154.000|20110123034156.000|TR0|at a specific spot.  But thieves are 
20110123034156.000|20110123034158.000|TR0|learning to pick up the signal and getting 
20110123034158.000|20110123034201.000|TR0|your credit card info literally through 
20110123034201.000|20110123034203.000|TR0|the air.
20110123034203.000|20110123034205.000|TR0|
20110123034205.000|20110123034208.000|TR0|Cyber security expert Gregory Evans is 
20110123034208.000|20110123034210.000|TR0|here to offer his advice on how to avoid 
20110123034210.000|20110123034212.000|TR0|becoming a victim.
20110123034212.000|20110123034215.000|TR0|
20110123034215.000|20110123034217.000|TR0|And Gregory, first of all, let me ask you. 
20110123034217.000|20110123034219.000|TR0| Let's start with the basics.  RFID, what 
20110123034219.000|20110123034222.000|TR0|exactly is that?
20110123034222.000|20110123034224.000|TR0|
20110123034224.000|20110123034226.000|TR0|GREGORY EVANS, CEO, LIGATT SECURITY:  RFID 
20110123034226.000|20110123034228.000|TR0|is like a miniature chip that puts off 
20110123034228.000|20110123034231.000|TR0|this signal.  It's like an identification 
20110123034231.000|20110123034233.000|TR0|chip. You're putting it -- they're putting 
20110123034233.000|20110123034235.000|TR0|them on packages now.  So like right now 
20110123034235.000|20110123034238.000|TR0|you see a bar code.  Now you have an RFID 
20110123034238.000|20110123034240.000|TR0|code that would be on there as well.
20110123034240.000|20110123034242.000|TR0|
20110123034242.000|20110123034245.000|TR0|SAVIDGE:  So they're very, very small.
20110123034245.000|20110123034247.000|TR0|
20110123034247.000|20110123034249.000|TR0|EVANS:  Very small.
20110123034249.000|20110123034252.000|TR0|
20110123034252.000|20110123034254.000|TR0|SAVIDGE:  And cheap and easy to place.
20110123034254.000|20110123034256.000|TR0|
20110123034256.000|20110123034259.000|TR0|EVANS:  Yes.  And you can find them on 
20110123034259.000|20110123034301.000|TR0|credit cards now as well, so.
20110123034301.000|20110123034303.000|TR0|
20110123034303.000|20110123034306.000|TR0|SAVIDGE:  And this is where we start to 
20110123034306.000|20110123034308.000|TR0|run into the problems as we saw.  What 
20110123034308.000|20110123034310.000|TR0|happens?
20110123034310.000|20110123034313.000|TR0|
20110123034313.000|20110123034315.000|TR0|EVANS:  Well, what happens is anything 
20110123034315.000|20110123034317.000|TR0|that's transmitted in the air like the 
20110123034317.000|20110123034320.000|TR0|information on RFID or even like your cell 
20110123034320.000|20110123034322.000|TR0|phones, anything that's in the air can be 
20110123034322.000|20110123034324.000|TR0|captured, OK.  And if someone can capture 
20110123034324.000|20110123034327.000|TR0|it, then that means that they can read it.
20110123034327.000|20110123034329.000|TR0|
20110123034329.000|20110123034331.000|TR0|Now, it depends on the encryption.  That's 
20110123034331.000|20110123034333.000|TR0|the level.  That's one of the biggest 
20110123034333.000|20110123034336.000|TR0|things that we have to be worried about as 
20110123034336.000|20110123034338.000|TR0|consumers using these.  They're being 
20110123034338.000|20110123034340.000|TR0|forced upon us.  Like for instance, you're 
20110123034340.000|20110123034343.000|TR0|not asking for the credit card to come 
20110123034343.000|20110123034345.000|TR0|with an RFID, but credit card companies 
20110123034345.000|20110123034347.000|TR0|are actually putting RFID on the cards now.
20110123034347.000|20110123034350.000|TR0|
20110123034350.000|20110123034352.000|TR0|SAVIDGE:  What do they want now?  What do 
20110123034352.000|20110123034354.000|TR0|they care?
20110123034354.000|20110123034357.000|TR0|
20110123034357.000|20110123034359.000|TR0|EVANS:  Well, because it makes it a lot 
20110123034359.000|20110123034401.000|TR0|easier, and a lot of the merchants, it's 
20110123034401.000|20110123034404.000|TR0|more of convenience.  Even though we don't 
20110123034404.000|20110123034406.000|TR0|need that, they're adding that on there.
20110123034406.000|20110123034408.000|TR0|
20110123034408.000|20110123034411.000|TR0|SAVIDGE:  In other words, it's easier for 
20110123034411.000|20110123034413.000|TR0|us to use there but we would use and spend
